first_reasoning: We’re allocating the full $10 million to the Consumer Products Division because its relatively small margin erosion on a large revenue base can be reversed quickly with focused design and usability improvements. A rapid prototyping cycle, clear cost-engineering targets, and pilot-market feedback should restore profitability well before industrial upgrades could pay off. Our agreed milestones—innovation brief, tech-health review, prototype pilots with NPS and cost data, and a nine-month go/no-go decision—give us tight oversight and the flexibility to reallocate if performance lags.
second_reasoning: We’re directing the entire $20 million to the Consumer Products Division because its small recent losses on a large revenue base can be reversed quickly with targeted product design, cost engineering, and user-experience enhancements. The division can move from innovation brief to market-tested prototypes and NPS-anchored feedback far faster than the heavy capital retooling Industrial requires. Our rigorous milestones—quarter-end brief, three-month tech review, six-month pilot data with cost and NPS metrics, and a nine-month go/no-go decision—ensure tight oversight and flexible reallocation if targets aren’t met.
